Message: Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
I'm not seeing a place to target my ads by interest, where do I do that?

To target your ads by interest on NewsBreak, you need to access the Ad Management section. When creating a campaign, after selecting your campaign objective and setting up your ad set, you'll have the option to choose targeting criteria. Here, you can build an audience based on interests, demographics, and location. If you're having trouble finding this option, make sure you're in the right section of the Ad Management tool.
In my ad managment page I can't easily see the informaion. I only see part of one row.

It sounds like there might be a display issue on your Ad Management page. Here are a few things you can try to resolve it:

1. **Refresh the Page:** Sometimes, simply refreshing the page can fix display issues.

2. **Clear Cache and Cookies:** Try clearing your browser's cache and cookies, as this can help with loading issues.

3. **Check Browser Compatibility:** Ensure you're using a compatible browser, such as Chrome or Firefox, which are generally recommended for optimal performance.

4. **Zoom Settings:** Check if your browser's zoom settings are affecting the display. Resetting to default zoom might help.

If these steps don't resolve the issue, please reach out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
I need to remove my credit card information

Once you've uploaded your primary payment method, you can't remove your credit card from your account. However, you can update it with another card if needed. If you have any issues or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com.
how do I make sure I'm not charged anymore?

To ensure you're not charged anymore, you can pause or stop your ad campaigns. Additionally, if you're using Autopay, make sure to update your payment method with another card or contact adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance. Remember that ad credits are used before your primary payment method.
